description: This notification is sent when the specific
trunk RED alarm condition clears.

event.Summary: Loss of signal (RED alarm) on trunk $v1 cleared

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkRedClear VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIdentifier s EXAMPLE VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1cardSlotNumber i 1 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkDeviceNumber i 0 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex i 9999

description: This value for this object is equal to the
value of dsx1CircuitIdentifier
from the Configuration table of
DS1/E1 (RFC 1406). This is a vendor specific
field used to help identify each specific
interface for diagnostic purposes.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIdentifier

description: Physical slot in the system in which the
card is installed.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1cardSlotNumber

description: The value for this object is the logical device number of
this trunk within its slot. This number may be used to
identify this device in the registry.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkDeviceNumber

description: This object is the index into the number
of trunks associated with the card defined
in the card group.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex

description: This notification is sent when the specific
trunk goes into the RED alarm situation. Red
alarm condition signifies LOS (Loss of Signal)
failure, i.e. the receiver sees no positive or
negative pulses

event.Summary: Loss of signal (RED alarm) on trunk $v1

description: This notification is sent when the specific
trunk YELLOW alarm condition clears.

event.Summary: Loss of frame (YELLOW alarm) on trunk $v1 cleared

description: This notification is sent when the specific
trunk goes into the YELLOW alarm situation.
Yellow alarm condition signifies a LOF (Loss
of Frame) condition, i.e. the receiver does not
see the expected framing pattern.

event.Summary: Loss of frame (YELLOW alarm) on trunk $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkBlueClear VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIdentifier s EXAMPLE VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1cardSlotNumber i 1 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkDeviceNumber i 0 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex i 9999

of trunks associated with the card defined

variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex

description: This notification is sent when the specific
trunk goes into the BLUE alarm situation. Blue alarm
conditions occurs when the source goes into AIS (Alarm
indication Signal) state. This means that the source has
a problem that prevents it from sending its normal, framed
payload. Instead, it sends an unframed stream of 1's.

event.Summary: Alarm indication signal (BLUE alarm) on trunk $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkBlue VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIdentifier s EXAMPLE VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1cardSlotNumber i 1 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkDeviceNumber i 0 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex i 9999

variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex

description: This notification is sent when the specific
trunk successfully reads and incorporates the
values from the registry. This is typically done
in response to a SET command on any of the Trunk's (or
its channel's) read-write parameters
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkReconfigComplete VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIdentifier s EXAMPLE VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1cardSlotNumber i 1 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkDeviceNumber i 0 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex i 9999

description: This value for this object is equal to the
value of dsx1CircuitIdentifier
from the Configuration table of
DS1/E1 (RFC 1406). This is a vendor specific
field used to help identify each specific
interface for diagnostic purposes.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIdentifier

description: Physical slot in the system in which the
card is installed.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1cardSlotNumber

description: The value for this object is the logical device number of
this trunk within its slot. This number may be used to
identify this device in the registry.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkDeviceNumber

description: This object is the index into the number
of trunks associated with the card defined
in the card group.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex

description: This notification is sent when the specific
trunk fails to incorporate the values read from
the registry. Typically, the trunk tries to re-read
the registry values in response to a SET command on
any of the Trunk's (or its channel's) read-write parameters
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkReconfigError VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIdentifier s EXAMPLE VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1cardSlotNumber i 1 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkDeviceNumber i 0 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex i 9999

description: This value for this object is equal to the
value of dsx1CircuitIdentifier
from the Configuration table of
DS1/E1 (RFC 1406). This is a vendor specific
field used to help identify each specific
interface for diagnostic purposes.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIdentifier

description: Physical slot in the system in which the
card is installed.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1cardSlotNumber

description: The value for this object is the logical device number of
this trunk within its slot. This number may be used to
identify this device in the registry.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkDeviceNumber

description: This object is the index into the number
of trunks associated with the card defined
in the card group.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex

description: This notification is sent when the specific
trunk enters a payload loopback state. Payload loopback means that
the received signal at this interface is looped through the
device. Typically the received signal is looped back for re-
transmission after it has passed through the device's framing function
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkLoopbackPayloadOn VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIdentifier s EXAMPLE VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1cardSlotNumber i 1 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkDeviceNumber i 0 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex i 9999

description: This value for this object is equal to the
value of dsx1CircuitIdentifier
from the Configuration table of
DS1/E1 (RFC 1406). This is a vendor specific
field used to help identify each specific
interface for diagnostic purposes.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIdentifier

description: Physical slot in the system in which the
card is installed.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1cardSlotNumber

description: The value for this object is the logical device number of
this trunk within its slot. This number may be used to
identify this device in the registry.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkDeviceNumber

description: This object is the index into the number
of trunks associated with the card defined
in the card group.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex

description: This notification is sent when the specific
trunk moves from a payload loopback state to a
non loopback state.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkLoopbackPayloadOff VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIdentifier s EXAMPLE VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1cardSlotNumber i 1 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkDeviceNumber i 0 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex i 9999

description: This value for this object is equal to the
value of dsx1CircuitIdentifier

DS1/E1 (RFC 1406). This is a vendor specific
field used to help identify each specific
interface for diagnostic purposes.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIdentifier

description: Physical slot in the system in which the

description: The value for this object is the logical device number of

variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex

description: This notification is sent when the specific
trunk enters a line loopback state. Under this state the received
signal at this interface does not go through the device
(minimum penetration) but is looped back out.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkLoopbackLineOn VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIdentifier s EXAMPLE VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1cardSlotNumber i 1 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkDeviceNumber i 0 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex i 9999

description: This value for this object is equal to the
value of dsx1CircuitIdentifier
from the Configuration table of
DS1/E1 (RFC 1406). This is a vendor specific
field used to help identify each specific
interface for diagnostic purposes.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIdentifier

description: Physical slot in the system in which the
card is installed.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1cardSlotNumber

description: The value for this object is the logical device number of

variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkDeviceNumber

description: This object is the index into the number
of trunks associated with the card defined
in the card group.
variables.name: VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex

description: This notification is sent when the specific
trunk goes out of a Line Looped state
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkLoopbackLineOff VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIdentifier s EXAMPLE VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1cardSlotNumber i 1 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkDeviceNumber i 0 VERTICALT1-E1-MIB::vdsx1TrunkIndex i 9999
